definition[0]: when a business or an activity makes a profit, or the amount of profit it makes
definition[1]: the state of producing a profit, or the degree to which an activity, company etc is profitable
example[1]: restructuring proposals to helpboost profitability (=increase it)
example[2]: Earnings were helped by improved profitability in the fashions division.
example[3]: S&P said the lower ratings reflect the bank’s declining (=falling) profitability.
example[4]: the company’s effort to return its credit card operation to profitability (=make it profitable again)
